abstracts.cdata!:
The project would provide technical
            assistance to the Government for: (a) the initial
            functioning, within the Presidency, of the Department of
            Petroleum Affairs (DPA), responsible for administering the
            country's petroleum sector; and (b) the strengthening
            of the overall management of the energy sector. The project
            would include: (a) exploration monitoring: (i) about 46
            man-months of the services of experts to assist DPA in
            evaluating the financial and technical aspects of
            exploration contracts with oil companies, monitoring
            companies' activities, processing exploration related
            information, and periodically re-evaluating the
            country's hydrocarbon potential; and (ii) training for
            government officials in the most important aspects of
            petroleum exploration and economics. (b) establishment of an
            energy sector information system: to assist in the
            systematic collection and processing of basic data on the
            energy sector, including energy output, imports, and demand,
            and preparation of an energy consumption survey; and (c)
            project administration.
